#summary FLEV System UseCase Template (Issue 4)
#labels Phase-Requirements

==Narrative==

Miranda signs up for a use case that involves maintaining the set of people who particpate in an application workflow. Since it's a basic CRUD operation, she decided to use the FLEV widget. Miranda creates a "Contacts.html" page and a "Contacts.js" script page. 

The Contacts script constructs a working instance from the !FlevBase object, and then configures the instance to edit Contact entries. Per the application architecture, she adds the Contacts constructor to the singleton MY namespace. 

Miranda configures the oColumnHeaders, oResponseSchema, oConfigs, and sItemName to match the client use case. Since this will be the only flev widget on the page, she can use the default element names, and so those items do not need to be configured. To make it easy to test the widget, Miranda also adds a test dataset. 

Miranda creates the Contacts.html page by referring to one of the flev example pages. For the autocomplete filter, she adds her own list of field names. 

To bootstrap the initial dataset, Miranda extends the my.js script to create a !ContactsLoad event and provide onContactsLoadReturn callback handler.

Miranda subscribes the flev's load method to the contactsLoad event. When the RPC call returns, it will fire the contactsLoad event, which will trigger the load method, bootstrapping the widget. 

But before trying the RPC method, Miranda configures the page to use the static test data first.

==Goal==

The most common workflow in any business application is Finder / Lister / Editor / Viewer or "FLEV". A FLEV widget would allow us to define a columnset and datasource once and use it to generate all four presentations.

|| *Level* || System Component || 
|| *Trigger* || Find matching entity to view or edit details  || 
|| *Primary Actor* || Developer ||

==Main Success Scenario (MSS)==

|| *Step* || *Action* ||
|| *1*    || Open script file named for file that will be using the widget ($Page.js). ||
|| *2*    || Add constructor for widget, using FlevBase as the initial object instance. ||
|| *3*    || Configure oColumnHeaders, oResponseSchema, and sItemName. ||
|| *4*    || Open corresponding HTML file ($Page.html). ||
|| *5*    || Edit example markup to reference to list relevent fields names in the "elListForm" ||
|| *6*    || Extend application script to defined a load event and callback handler for this widget ||
|| *7*    || Edit example page script to reference relevent objects and RPC methods. ||

    oSelf.oConfigs = oSelf.CONFIGS;
    oSelf.sItemName = "last_name";
}}}

{{{
    <script type="text/javascript">
        var fnReady = function() {
            var oView = new MY.View("elBody","Contacts");
            _Self = new MY.Contacts(); // Convenience "global" for this page.
            oView.oContent = _Self;
            my.oEvents.subscribe("contactsLoad", _Self.load, _Self);                           Contacts.rpc.contactsList(
              my.oEvents.onContactsLoadReturn).call(ANVIL.channel);
};
        YAHOO.util.Event.onContentReady("elBody",fnReady);
    </script>
}}}
